name: Diwali
tagline: The Festival of Lights illuminating hearts and homes

overview.brief: Diwali, the Festival of Lights, celebrates the victory of light over darkness and good over evil. It commemorates Lord Rama's return to Ayodhya after 14 years of exile.
overview.history: The word 'Diwali' comes from the Sanskrit 'Deepavali', meaning 'row of lights'. The festival spans five days, with the main celebration on the third day. Each day has its own significance and rituals, making it one of the most important Hindu festivals.
overview.significance: Diwali symbolizes the spiritual victory of light over darkness, knowledge over ignorance, and hope over despair. It's celebrated by Hindus, Jains, Sikhs, and Buddhists worldwide.

howToCelebrate.title: Clean and Prepare Your Home
howToCelebrate.description: Start by thoroughly cleaning your home 2-3 days before Diwali. This represents removing negativity and welcoming prosperity. Declutter, organize, and create space for positive energy.

howToCelebrate.title: Create Beautiful Rangoli
howToCelebrate.description: Draw colorful rangoli patterns at your entrance using colored powder, flower petals, or rice flour. Start with simple geometric patterns if you're a beginner.

howToCelebrate.title: Light Diyas and Candles
howToCelebrate.description: Light oil lamps (diyas) and place them around your home - at the entrance, windows, and in your prayer area. The light represents the triumph of good over evil.

howToCelebrate.title: Perform Lakshmi Puja
howToCelebrate.description: In the evening, perform Lakshmi puja to invite wealth and prosperity. Clean your puja area, place Lakshmi idols, offer flowers, sweets, and light incense.

howToCelebrate.title: Exchange Gifts and Sweets
howToCelebrate.description: Share traditional sweets and gifts with family, friends, and neighbors. This strengthens bonds and spreads joy throughout the community.

recipes.name: Besan Ladoo
recipes.description: Sweet, aromatic balls made from roasted gram flour, ghee, and sugar
instructions: Heat ghee in a heavy-bottomed pan on medium heat
Add besan and roast continuously, stirring to avoid burning
Cook until besan turns golden brown and releases a nutty aroma (20-25 minutes)
Remove from heat and let cool for 5 minutes
Add powdered sugar, cardamom powder, and nuts
Mix well until combined
While still warm, shape into small balls (add milk if mixture is too dry)
Let cool completely before storing
tips: Roast besan on low-medium heat to avoid burning
The mixture should be warm when shaping, not hot
Store in an airtight container for up to 2 weeks

recipes.name: Chakli
recipes.description: Crispy, spiral-shaped savory snack perfect for festival celebrations
instructions: Mix rice flour, gram flour, sesame seeds, cumin seeds, spices, and salt
Add softened butter and mix until crumbly
Gradually add water and knead into a smooth, pliable dough
Fill the chakli press with dough
Heat oil in a deep pan on medium-high heat
Press chakli directly into hot oil in spiral shapes
Fry until golden and crisp (2-3 minutes per side)
Drain on paper towels and cool completely
tips: Dough should be soft but not sticky
Oil should be hot enough that dough sizzles immediately
Store in airtight containers for up to 3 weeks

recipes.name: Gulab Jamun
recipes.description: Soft, syrup-soaked milk-based dumplings, a Diwali favorite
ingredients: For syrup: 2 cups sugar, 2 cups water, 4 cardamom pods, few saffron strands
instructions: Make sugar syrup: Boil sugar and water with cardamom until slightly sticky. Keep warm
Mix milk powder, flour, baking soda, and ghee
Add milk gradually to form a soft dough
Divide into 15 small balls, rolling smoothly without cracks
Heat oil on medium-low heat (too hot will brown outside quickly)
Fry balls slowly, stirring gently, until deep golden brown
Remove and immediately immerse in warm sugar syrup
Let soak for at least 2 hours before serving
tips: Low heat is crucial for even cooking
Balls should be smooth with no cracks
Serve warm or at room temperature

recipes.name: Karanji
recipes.description: Crispy half-moon pastries filled with coconut and jaggery
ingredients: For dough: 2 cups all-purpose flour, 2 tbsp ghee, water as needed
For filling: 2 cups grated coconut, 1 cup jaggery, 1/4 cup poppy seeds, 1/2 tsp cardamom powder
instructions: Make filling: Cook coconut, jaggery, poppy seeds, and cardamom until dry. Cool completely
Make dough: Mix flour and ghee, add water to form stiff dough. Rest 30 minutes
Roll small portions into thin circles
Place filling on one half, fold and seal edges with fork
Deep fry on medium heat until golden and crisp
Drain and cool completely
tips: Filling must be completely cool before using
Seal edges properly to prevent opening during frying
Store in airtight container for up to 2 weeks

recipes.name: Kaju Katli
recipes.description: Luxurious diamond-shaped cashew fudge, the king of Indian sweets
instructions: Grind cashews into fine powder without releasing oil
Make sugar syrup with water until one-string consistency
Add cashew powder and cardamom, mix continuously
Cook on low heat until mixture leaves sides of pan
Transfer to greased surface, knead while warm
Roll between parchment paper to 1/4 inch thickness
Cut into diamond shapes while still warm
Apply silver leaf if desired
tips: Sugar syrup consistency is crucial - test between fingers
Work quickly as mixture sets fast
Store in airtight container for up to 1 week

decorations.title: Traditional Rangoli Designs
decorations.description: Create stunning floor art at your entrance using colored powders, flower petals, or rice flour. Rangoli welcomes guests and invites prosperity.
steps: Clean the floor area thoroughly and dry
Draw your design lightly with chalk
Fill in with colored powders, working from center outward
Add flower petals for extra beauty
Border with small diyas or tea lights

decorations.title: Diya Arrangements
decorations.description: Transform your home with beautiful oil lamp arrangements that symbolize the victory of light over darkness.
steps: Place diyas at entrance, windows, balconies
Fill with oil and place cotton wicks
Arrange on decorative plates with flower petals
Light at sunset on Diwali evening
beginnerTips: Use LED diyas for safety with children
Create clusters of 3 or 5 for visual impact

decorations.title: Marigold Decorations
decorations.description: Brighten your home with vibrant marigold flowers, considered auspicious during Diwali.
steps: Hang torans on doors and windows
Float flowers in decorative bowls with water and diyas
beginnerTips: Buy fresh flowers on Diwali morning
Use artificial flowers for longer-lasting decor

decorations.title: Color Theme Decoration
decorations.description: Use traditional Diwali colors to create a festive atmosphere throughout your home.
materials: Gold and red fabrics or cushions
steps: Add gold and red accent pieces
Hang paper lanterns or fairy lights
Create a festive corner with all decorations together
beginnerTips: Focus on entrance and living room first
Use removable hooks for hanging items
Coordinate colors - gold, red, orange, deep pink

name: Holi
tagline: The Festival of Colors celebrating love, joy, and new beginnings

overview.brief: Holi celebrates the arrival of spring and the victory of good over evil. It's a festival of colors where people play with gulal (colored powder) and water.
overview.history: Holi's origins trace back to ancient Hindu texts. The festival commemorates the burning of Holika and celebrates the divine love of Radha and Krishna.
overview.significance: Holi represents forgiveness, the triumph of good, and the joy of spring. It breaks down social barriers as everyone plays together with colors.

howToCelebrate.title: Prepare Safe Colors
howToCelebrate.description: Use natural, skin-safe colors made from flowers and herbs. You can make them at home using turmeric (yellow), beetroot (pink), spinach (green), and indigo (blue).

howToCelebrate.title: Holika Dahan (Night Before)
howToCelebrate.description: On the evening before Holi, participate in Holika Dahan - lighting a bonfire that symbolizes the victory of good over evil. Gather with community, sing, and pray.

howToCelebrate.title: Prepare for Color Play
howToCelebrate.description: Wear old white clothes, apply coconut oil on skin and hair for protection, and prepare water guns and color packets.

howToCelebrate.title: Play with Colors
howToCelebrate.description: Start by applying colors respectfully. Say 'Bura na mano, Holi hai!' (Don't mind, it's Holi!) Play with family and friends, spreading joy and laughter.

howToCelebrate.title: Enjoy Traditional Foods
howToCelebrate.description: After playing, clean up and enjoy special Holi delicacies like gujiya, thandai, and various sweets with loved ones.

recipes.name: Gujiya
recipes.description: Crescent-shaped sweet pastries filled with khoya and dry fruits
ingredients: For dough: 2 cups all-purpose flour, 4 tbsp ghee, water as needed
For filling: 1 cup khoya (mawa), 1/2 cup powdered sugar, 1/4 cup chopped cashews, 1/4 cup chopped almonds, 2 tbsp raisins, 1/2 tsp cardamom powder, 1 tbsp coconut (optional)
instructions: Make filling: Crumble khoya and roast lightly until aromatic
Mix with sugar, nuts, raisins, and cardamom. Cool completely
Make dough: Mix flour and ghee until crumbly. Add water to make stiff dough
Rest dough for 30 minutes covered
Roll small portions into thin circles (4-5 inch diameter)
Place filling on one half, fold over and seal edges with decorative crimping
Deep fry on medium heat until golden brown
Drain and cool completely
tips: Dough should be stiff for crispy gujiya
Don't overfill or they'll open during frying
Store in airtight container for up to 2 weeks

recipes.name: Thandai
recipes.description: Cooling spiced milk drink perfect for Holi celebrations
instructions: Soak almonds, cashews, melon seeds, and poppy seeds overnight
Grind soaked nuts, seeds, spices, and saffron with little water into smooth paste
Mix paste with sugar and 1 cup milk in a bowl
Strain through fine cloth, extracting all liquid
Mix strained concentrate with remaining cold milk
Chill for at least 2 hours
Serve cold, garnished with rose petals and saffron strands
tips: Adjust sugar to taste
Make concentrate a day ahead
Serve extra cold with ice

recipes.name: Malpua
recipes.description: Sweet, fluffy pancakes soaked in sugar syrup
ingredients: For syrup: 1 cup sugar, 1/2 cup water, few saffron strands
instructions: Make sugar syrup: Boil sugar and water until slightly sticky. Keep warm
Mix flour, semolina, mashed banana, milk, sugar, and cardamom
Make thick batter (pouring consistency). Rest 20 minutes
Heat ghee in flat pan on medium heat
Pour ladle of batter, spread slightly
Fry until golden on both sides
Immediately immerse in warm sugar syrup for 30 seconds
Serve warm, garnished with rabri or chopped nuts
tips: Batter should be thick but pourable
Keep flame medium to cook through without burning
Best served fresh and warm

recipes.name: Dahi Bhalla
recipes.description: Soft lentil fritters in creamy yogurt with chutneys
ingredients: 1 cup urad dal (split black gram - soaked 4 hours)
instructions: Grind soaked dal to smooth, fluffy batter with minimal water
Heat oil for deep frying on medium-high
Drop small portions of batter and fry until golden
Soak fried bhallas in warm water for 20 minutes
Squeeze gently to remove excess water
Whisk yogurt with salt and a little water to make it creamy
Arrange bhallas in serving dish, pour yogurt over
Drizzle both chutneys, sprinkle spices and coriander
tips: Batter should be light and fluffy
Soak in warm water to soften bhallas
Assemble just before serving

recipes.name: Puran Poli
recipes.description: Sweet flatbread stuffed with lentil and jaggery filling
ingredients: For dough: 2 cups whole wheat flour, 2 tbsp oil, water as needed
For filling: 1 cup chana dal (soaked 2 hours), 1 cup jaggery, 1/2 tsp cardamom powder, 1/4 tsp nutmeg powder, 2 tbsp ghee
instructions: Cook chana dal until very soft. Drain completely
Mash dal and cook with jaggery until mixture leaves sides
Add cardamom and nutmeg. Cool completely
Make soft dough with flour, oil, and water. Rest 30 minutes
Divide dough and filling into equal portions
Roll dough ball, place filling, seal and roll gently into flatbread
Cook on hot griddle with ghee until golden spots appear
Serve warm with ghee
tips: Filling should be dry, not sticky
Roll gently to prevent filling from coming out
Serve warm for best taste

decorations.title: Making Natural Holi Colors
decorations.description: Create safe, eco-friendly colors at home using natural ingredients.
steps: Mix each colored powder with equal parts flour/cornstarch
For liquid colors, mix with water
Test on small skin area first
beginnerTips: Natural colors are gentler on skin

decorations.title: Holi Party Decoration
decorations.description: Create a vibrant, colorful party space for Holi celebrations.
materials: Colored chalk or paint for floor art
steps: Hang white sheet backdrop for color throwing
Create balloon arches in rainbow colors
Set up color stations with different colors
beginnerTips: Provide towels and water for cleanup

name: Ganesh Chaturthi
tagline: Celebrating the birth of the remover of obstacles

overview.brief: Ganesh Chaturthi celebrates the birth of Lord Ganesha, the elephant-headed deity who removes obstacles and brings wisdom. It's one of Maharashtra's most beloved festivals.
overview.history: The festival has been celebrated since the days of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj, but gained prominence during the Indian freedom movement. Lokmanya Tilak transformed it into a public celebration to unite people.
overview.significance: Lord Ganesha symbolizes wisdom, prosperity, and good fortune. The festival teaches the importance of environmental consciousness through eco-friendly celebrations.

howToCelebrate.title: Bring Ganesha Home
howToCelebrate.description: Choose an eco-friendly clay Ganesha idol. Traditionally, families bring Bappa home on the first day with great reverence and celebration.

howToCelebrate.title: Installation Ceremony (Sthapana)
howToCelebrate.description: Perform the pranapratishtha ceremony to invoke Lord Ganesha. Place the idol on a decorated platform, offer flowers, and perform aarti.

howToCelebrate.title: Daily Puja for 10 Days
howToCelebrate.description: Offer prayers twice daily, present modaks and flowers, chant mantras, and sing devotional songs. Maintain cleanliness around the idol.

howToCelebrate.title: Prepare Traditional Modaks
howToCelebrate.description: Make Lord Ganesha's favorite sweet - modaks. These can be steamed or fried, filled with coconut and jaggery.

howToCelebrate.title: Visarjan (Immersion)
howToCelebrate.description: On the final day, bid farewell to Ganesha with procession, music, and dancing. Immerse the idol in water saying 'Ganpati Bappa Morya, Pudhchya Varshi Lavkar Ya!'

recipes.name: Ukadiche Modak
recipes.description: Steamed rice flour dumplings filled with coconut and jaggery
ingredients: For covering: 1 cup rice flour, 1 cup water, 1 tsp ghee, pinch of salt
For filling: 1 cup grated coconut, 3/4 cup jaggery, 1/2 tsp cardamom powder, 1 tbsp poppy seeds (optional)
instructions: Make filling: Heat jaggery until melted, add coconut, cardamom, poppy seeds. Cook until dry. Cool
Boil water with ghee and salt. Add rice flour, mix quickly
Knead into smooth dough while warm
Make small balls, flatten into cups, add filling
Seal and shape into dumplings with pleats
Steam for 10-12 minutes
Brush with ghee and serve warm
tips: Dough must be kneaded while warm
Keep dough covered to prevent drying
Traditional modaks have 21 pleats

recipes.name: Fried Modak
recipes.description: Crispy fried version of the traditional modak
ingredients: For dough: 2 cups all-purpose flour, 2 tbsp ghee, water as needed
For filling: 1 cup coconut, 3/4 cup jaggery, 1/2 tsp cardamom powder
instructions: Prepare filling same as ukadiche modak. Cool completely
Make stiff dough with flour, ghee, and water. Rest 30 minutes
Roll small portions into circles
Place filling, fold and shape into modak
Deep fry on medium heat until golden
Drain and serve
tips: Dough should be stiff for crispy texture
Seal properly to prevent opening
Store in airtight container for 1 week

recipes.name: Sundal
recipes.description: Protein-rich boiled chickpea salad with spices
instructions: Boil chickpeas until tender but firm
Heat oil, add mustard seeds, urad dal, chilies, curry leaves
Add boiled chickpeas and salt
Mix well and cook for 2 minutes
Add grated coconut and mix
Serve as prasad
tips: Don't overcook chickpeas
Can use different lentils
Serve at room temperature

decorations.title: Ganesha Makhar Setup
decorations.description: Create a beautiful throne (makhar) for Lord Ganesha with traditional decorations.
steps: Build a raised platform (6-12 inches high)
Create backdrop with flowers and lights

name: Navratri
tagline: Nine nights of divine feminine worship and celebration

overview.brief: Navratri celebrates the divine feminine in her nine forms over nine nights. It's a time of fasting, prayer, dance, and celebration across India.
overview.history: Navratri celebrates the victory of Goddess Durga over the demon Mahishasura, symbolizing the triumph of good over evil. Different regions celebrate with their own unique traditions.
overview.significance: The nine nights honor nine forms of Goddess Durga, representing different aspects of Shakti (divine feminine energy). It's a time for spiritual renewal and community celebration.

howToCelebrate.title: Prepare for Fasting
howToCelebrate.description: Clean your home and prepare for nine days of fasting. Stock sattvic (pure) foods like fruits, nuts, and fasting-friendly grains like sabudana and kuttu.

howToCelebrate.title: Kalash Sthapana
howToCelebrate.description: On day one, establish the sacred kalash (pot) with water, coconut, and mango leaves. This represents the presence of the goddess.

howToCelebrate.title: Daily Puja and Fasting
howToCelebrate.description: Observe daily puja in the morning and evening. Maintain fasting according to your tradition - full fast, fruit fast, or one meal.

howToCelebrate.title: Participate in Garba/Dandiya
howToCelebrate.description: Join community celebrations with traditional Garba and Dandiya Raas dances. Wear colorful traditional attire and celebrate with joy.

howToCelebrate.title: Kanya Pujan
howToCelebrate.description: On the eighth or ninth day, worship young girls as manifestations of the goddess. Offer them food and gifts with devotion.

recipes.name: Sabudana Khichdi
recipes.description: Tapioca pearl pilaf perfect for fasting
instructions: Soak sabudana in water for 4 hours. Drain completely
Heat ghee, add cumin, chilies, curry leaves
Add potatoes, cook until tender
Add sabudana, peanuts, salt
Mix gently, cook covered on low heat for 5-7 minutes
Add lemon juice and coriander
Serve hot
tips: Drain sabudana well to avoid stickiness
Use rock salt for fasting
Don't overcook sabudana

recipes.name: Kuttu Ki Puri
recipes.description: Buckwheat flour puffed bread for fasting
instructions: Mix flour, mashed potatoes, and salt
Add water gradually to form soft dough
Rest for 15 minutes
Divide into small balls
Roll into thin circles
Deep fry until puffed and golden
Serve hot with fasting curry
tips: Mashed potatoes help bind the dough
Don't make dough too tight
Fry on medium-high heat

recipes.name: Aloo Jeera (Fasting Style)
recipes.description: Simple cumin-flavored potatoes for fasting
instructions: Boil potatoes until tender
Heat ghee, add cumin and chilies
Add boiled potatoes and salt
Cook until slightly crispy
Add lemon juice and coriander
Serve hot
tips: Don't overcook potatoes
Adjust spice to taste
Pairs well with kuttu puri

decorations.title: Traditional Garba Decoration
decorations.description: Create a festive atmosphere for Garba celebrations with colorful decorations.
steps: Create seating area around dance space
beginnerTips: Use bright colors - red, yellow, orange, pink

name: Gudi Padwa
tagline: Maharashtra's New Year - New beginnings and prosperity

overview.brief: Gudi Padwa marks the Marathi New Year and the arrival of spring. It's celebrated with traditional flags (gudi), new clothes, and special foods.
overview.history: The festival commemorates the coronation of Lord Rama and the victories of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj. The gudi represents victory and prosperity.
overview.significance: It symbolizes new beginnings, good fortune, and the victory of good over evil. It's an auspicious day for starting new ventures.

howToCelebrate.title: Prepare the Gudi
howToCelebrate.description: Create a gudi by decorating a bamboo stick with bright cloth, neem leaves, mango leaves, and a garland. Top it with an inverted copper or silver pot.

howToCelebrate.title: Hoist the Gudi
howToCelebrate.description: Early morning, after oil bath, hoist the gudi outside your home or at a window. This invites prosperity and wards off evil.

howToCelebrate.title: Wear New Clothes
howToCelebrate.description: Dress in new traditional clothes, especially nauvari sarees for women. This represents fresh beginnings for the new year.

howToCelebrate.title: Prepare Traditional Foods
howToCelebrate.description: Make special dishes like puran poli and shrikhand. Start with neem leaves and jaggery (bitter-sweet symbolism).

howToCelebrate.title: Visit Temple and Family
howToCelebrate.description: Visit temples for blessings and spend time with family. Exchange greetings of 'Gudi Padwa chya hardik shubhechha!'

recipes.name: Puran Poli
recipes.description: Sweet flatbread with lentil-jaggery filling, a Gudi Padwa staple
ingredients: For dough: 2 cups whole wheat flour, 1 tbsp oil, water
For puran: 1 cup chana dal, 1.5 cups jaggery, 1/2 tsp cardamom, 1/4 tsp nutmeg
instructions: Cook chana dal until very soft, drain well
Mash dal, cook with jaggery until thick
Add cardamom and nutmeg, cool completely
Make soft dough, rest 30 minutes
Stuff dough balls with puran, roll gently
Cook on tawa with ghee until golden
Serve warm with milk or ghee
tips: Puran should be completely dry
Roll gently to keep filling inside
Best enjoyed fresh and warm

recipes.name: Shrikhand
recipes.description: Sweetened hung yogurt with saffron and cardamom
instructions: Hang yogurt in muslin cloth for 4 hours to remove water
Soak saffron in warm milk
Mix hung yogurt with sugar until smooth
Add saffron milk and cardamom
Chill for 2 hours
Garnish with nuts and serve
tips: Use fresh, thick yogurt
Remove all water for thick consistency
Adjust sugar to taste

recipes.name: Aamras
recipes.description: Sweet mango pulp, perfect for spring celebrations
instructions: Peel and chop mangoes
Blend into smooth puree
Add sugar and cardamom
Mix in milk for smooth consistency
Chill and serve
tips: Use sweet, ripe mangoes
Adjust consistency with milk
Serve with puran poli or puri

decorations.title: Traditional Gudi Decoration
decorations.description: Create the iconic gudi flag that symbolizes victory and prosperity.
steps: Tie cloth to top of bamboo stick
Tie neem and mango leaves below pot
Optionally tie sugar cane to stick
Hoist outside home or at window
beginnerTips: Use sturdy bamboo that won't bend

decorations.title: Gudi Padwa Rangoli
decorations.description: Welcome the new year with beautiful rangoli at your entrance.
steps: Draw traditional pattern with white powder

name: Makar Sankranti
tagline: Harvest festival celebrating the sun's journey north

overview.brief: Makar Sankranti celebrates the sun's transition into Capricorn (Makar), marking the end of winter and beginning of longer days. It's a joyous harvest festival.
overview.history: One of the few Hindu festivals based on the solar calendar. It has been celebrated for thousands of years to thank the sun god and celebrate the harvest.
overview.significance: The festival marks the beginning of Uttarayan (sun's northward journey), considered highly auspicious. It's a time to let go of the past and embrace new beginnings.

howToCelebrate.title: Early Morning Holy Bath
howToCelebrate.description: Take a bath in holy rivers or at home before sunrise. This cleanses body and soul, preparing for the auspicious day.

howToCelebrate.title: Offer Prayers to Sun God
howToCelebrate.description: Face east and offer water to the rising sun with prayers of gratitude. Thank the sun for light, warmth, and harvest.

howToCelebrate.title: Make Til-Gul Sweets
howToCelebrate.description: Prepare traditional sesame and jaggery sweets. Exchange with loved ones saying 'Til-gul ghya, god god bola' (Take til-gul, speak sweetly).

howToCelebrate.title: Fly Kites
howToCelebrate.description: Participate in the joyous tradition of kite flying. The sky fills with colorful kites as communities celebrate together.

howToCelebrate.title: Donate to Charity
howToCelebrate.description: Give to those in need - food, clothes, or money. This is considered highly auspicious on Makar Sankranti.

recipes.name: Til-Gul Ladoo
recipes.description: Traditional sesame and jaggery balls
instructions: Dry roast sesame seeds until they pop slightly. Cool
Roast peanuts and crush coarsely
Melt jaggery with 2 tbsp water until slightly thick
Add sesame seeds, peanuts, and cardamom
Mix well and remove from heat
While warm, shape into small balls with ghee on palms
Cool completely before storing
tips: Don't overcook jaggery or ladoos will become hard
Shape while warm but not hot
Store in airtight container

recipes.name: Puran Poli
recipes.description: Sweet flatbread traditional for Sankranti
instructions: Same as Gudi Padwa recipe
tips: Same as Gudi Padwa recipe

recipes.name: Khichdi
recipes.description: Rice and lentil comfort food for Sankranti
instructions: Wash rice and dal together
Heat ghee, add cumin seeds
Add rice, dal, turmeric, salt
Add 4 cups water and vegetables if using
Pressure cook for 3 whistles or cook covered until soft
Serve hot with ghee
tips: Adjust water for desired consistency
Add vegetables for nutrition
Serve with pickle or papad

decorations.title: Kite Flying Setup
decorations.description: Prepare for the traditional kite flying celebration.
